SEARCH
Package ePortfolio

Class MutualFund

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Investment
ePortfolio.MutualFund
public class MutualFund extends Investment
Represents a Mutual Fund investment in the ePortfolio system. A Mutual Fund is a type of Investment with a fixed redemption fee when units are sold. This class provides methods to calculate the book value and payment, as well as to adjust the book value when mutual fund units are sold.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • MutualFund

      public MutualFund(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price) throws Exception
      Constructs a new MutualFund object with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the unique symbol identifying the mutual fund
      name - the name of the mutual fund
      quantity - the number of units of the mutual fund
      price - the price per unit of the mutual fund
      Throws:
      Exception - if invalid arguments are provided (e.g., negative values)

  • Method Details

    • calculateBookValue

      public void calculateBookValue(int quantity, double price)
      Calculates and updates the book value for this mutual fund after a purchase. The book value is the total cost of the mutual fund units purchased.
      Specified by:
      calculateBookValue in class Investment
      Parameters:
      quantity - the number of mutual fund units purchased
      price - the price per mutual fund unit

    • payment

      public double payment(int quantity)
      Calculates the payment received after selling a specified quantity of mutual fund units. The payment excludes the redemption fee.
      Specified by:
      payment in class Investment
      Parameters:
      quantity - the number of mutual fund units sold
      Returns:
      the total payment after deducting the redemption fee

    • bValueSellC

      public void bValueSellC(int quantityOld)
      Adjusts the book value of the mutual fund after selling a specified quantity of units. The adjustment is based on the proportion of the mutual fund that remains.
      Overrides:
      bValueSellC in class Investment
      Parameters:
      quantityOld - the total quantity of mutual fund units before selling
